title: Berkshire Live: Tuesday 10 January - BBC News
summary: hunt for motorist who moved ambulance to park car .
m4 reopens after crash which caused 12-mile queues .
sex assault trial of entertainer rolf harris due to start .
new £ 50m science building for university of reading .

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: thank you for joining us again today .
we 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow with all berkshire 's latest news , travel , weather and sport .
stay in touch via our facebook and twitter pages .
author: Toby Wadey
BBC South

text: motorist moves ambulance to park car

documents.title: lee heron wants to set the record straight against yeovil
text: lee heron wants to set the record straight against yeovil

documents.title: plans for £ 50m university building
text: proposals for a new £ 50m academic building have been unveiled by the university of reading .
the four-floor construction would replace the institution 's engineering block which is set to be demolished .
it will house the health and life sciences department and become the new site of the cole museum of zoology .
the building planned for the whiteknights campus is expected to be completed by summer 2019 subject to planning permission .
author: Toby Wadey
BBC South

documents.title: ever lost your trousers in front of the queen ?
text: the bbc 's world affairs editor john simpson told bbc radio berkshire 's sarah walker about the incident that happened nearly 40 years ago .

documents.title: reading volunteers raise money for african dogs charity
text: it 's estimated that less than 7,000 'painted dogs ' or african wild dogs remain in the wild and zimbabwe is the last stronghold for this endangered species .
now , the piggott interact club is to present the painted dogs conservation with £ 500 they raised through various collection efforts .
the organisation , which has offices in berkshire , seeks to protect and increase the number of painted dogs in the wild .
this is by various conservation methods including anti-poaching , rehabilitation and monitoring their health .
author: Atif Rashid
BBC News

documents.title: reading academy director looks ahead to under-23 match
text: reading fc academy director lee heron is looking to carry on the under-23 side 's run in the efl trophy against yeovil tonight .
he told bbc radio berkshire : `` they did a number on us at our place , winning 2-0 , we had some good opportunities early on in the game which we probably should have taken .
`` the aim was to do the best we could in the group stage to give us the opportunity to get out of that group stage , and we 've done that now .
`` we try to get our boys out on loan and give them opportunities to get them league experience , we can do that in this competition in house . ''

documents.title: police 'concerned ' for missing woman
text: police say they are concerned about a woman who has been reported missing from her home in bracknell .
thames valley police said 39-year-old beverley carter left her home at about 08:00 today and was possibly seen at bus stop in bay road , reading , at about 09:00 .
beverley is white , with long brown hair and is 5ft 3ins .
she was wearing a green or black coat and could be wearing track suit bottoms or jeans , as well as trainers , the force said .

documents.title: mcnally is new face at irish
text: london irish have made a new addition to their squad with the signing of back row josh mcnally from london welsh .
mcnally , 26 , joins the exiles on a deal until the end of the season having spent more than two seasons with welsh .
he is also a senior aircraftman in the raf and has been released of his duty to play for irish where he could make his debut in saturday 's british and irish cup trip to connacht eagles .
author: Adam Williams
BBC Sport

documents.title: service at two reading gp surgeries branded 'unacceptable '
text: patients have complained of long waits for appointments and delays in getting prescriptions at circuit lane and priory avenue surgeries .
they 're run by a company called one medical group , who took over the surgeries and the bracknell urgent care centre in september 2016 .

documents.title: will we have snow in berkshire ?
text: the met office has issued a yellow warning for snow on thursday .
that means there is a small chance of us seeing snow while heavy rain and wind may prove hazardous on the day .

documents.title: man moves occupied ambulance to free up parking space
text: a man moved an ambulance , while staff were treating a patient , in order to free up a parking space for himself .
the incident took place in malt court , pelican lane in newbury on 29 december .
while ambulance staff were treating the patient in the rear of the ambulance , he got into the cab of the vehicle , removed the handbrake and moved the ambulance .
he then drove his vehicle into a car park space which the ambulance had been blocking .
the offender is described as a white man , aged about 50 and is about 5ft10ins with a slim build .
he was driving a red mini cooper with a registration plate starting rj60 .
there was no communication between the offender and the ambulance crew prior to the ambulance being moved .
the offender moved the ambulance in order to free up a parking space for himself , without considering if anyone was receiving treatment at the time .
his actions could have had very serious consequences for the patient , who was receiving emergency care . ''
author: Sarah Lee
BBC South

documents.title: weather latest : dry and bright afternoon ahead
text: after a murky start , some bright spells are forecast for this afternoon before clouds thicken later .
it is expected to get milder overnight with highs of 9c .

documents.title: reading university historian publishes 18th century recipe for chocolate wine
text: if you 've already jettisoned the new year 's resolutions , this 1726 recipe by john nott for chocolate wine calls for a pint of sherry , four and a half ounces of chocolate , sugar and flour .
historian dr ruth salt suggests using it to 'celebrate in style ' .

documents.title: raising owls at a berkshire boarding school
text: raising owls at a berkshire boarding school
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: 'cycle route will not lead to loss of capacity for traffic '
text: there will be no loss of capacity for general traffic when a new cycle route is built along bath road , reading council has pledged .
cycle route 422 is a joint project between reading borough council , bracknell forest council , west berkshire borough council and wokingham borough council .
the £ 450,000 route through reading 's bath road is being funded by thames valley berkshire local enterprise partnership ( lep ) and local contributions from each of the councils involved .
the bath road lidl development will contribute £ 50,000 towards the scheme as section 106 funding .

documents.title: new cycle route for reading along bath road
text: a plan to build the reading section of a cross-berkshire cycle route is set for approval on 16 january .

the first reading section of the £ 450,000 route will see a combination of shared cycle and pedestrian facilities built by the council on the northern side of the bath road , running between the borough boundary and along the bath road to southcote road , and advanced stop lines at signalised junctions .
author: Emma Midgley
BBC South

documents.title: paintings of reading in the 1970s go on display
text: new exhibition @ twitterid from jan 28 : ray atkins - the reading years .

documents.title: dinner lady 's cucumber , lemon curd and custard dessert 'highly commended '
text: a dinner lady from wokingham has been highly commended for her cucumber , lemon curd and custard dessert at a school chef competition .
sharon merrett , who cooks at the forest school , was representing berkshire in the south east regional heat of the annual competition to find the country 's best school chef .
author: Emma Midgley
BBC South

documents.title: john simpson talks about his experiences as foreign correspondent
text: john simpson is talking to bbc radio berkshire 's sarah walker about his years working as a foreign correspondent for the bbc .
the acclaimed broadcaster and journalist has been dodging bullets and breaking the biggest stories from around the world for 50 years .
you can listen again to the interview on the bbc iplayer .
author: Emma Midgley
BBC South

documents.title: plan published for £ 50m science building at university of reading
text: plans have been published for a new £ 50m health and life sciences building at the university of reading .
the new building will include wet and dry research laboratories , teaching facilities and office space for academics , postgraduate researchers and administrative staff .
it will also become the new site of the cole museum of zoology .

the health & life sciences building will provide a world-class suite of teaching and research facilities , enabling us to continue our tradition of outstanding teaching in biological sciences and pioneering research that addresses the global challenges in biomedical science . ''
author: Sarah Lee
BBC South

documents.title: 500 new jobs to be created in reading after tesco shake-up
text: up to 500 new jobs will be created in reading by the supermarket giant tesco .
it 's part of plans to move some grocery operations to the town 's distribution centre .
but the shake-up at tesco will also make one thousand people redundant and close two distribution centres .

documents.title: heavy traffic causing bus delays
text: heavy traffic is affecting our routes in caversham route 22,23,24,25 and 27 .
we apologise for any inconvenience .

documents.title: lane blocked on m3 due to accident
text: reports of one lane blocked due to an accident on the m3 london bound between j4 a331 / a331 blackwater valley route ( camberley ) and j3 a322 ( lightwater / bagshot ) .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: all lanes re-opened after earlier accident on m4
text: update : m4 : all lanes reopen after accident london-bound just after j10 ( wokingham ) , long delays back past j12 ( calcot ) starting to move .

documents.title: £ 1m nurse and midwife training centre
text: at a time when there 's a shortfall in midwives in the south , a new simulation centre has opened in reading to train midwives .
the university of west london , which runs the college , has invested £ 1m into the centre , which is equipped with the latest technology and learning aids .
author: Sarah Lee
BBC South

documents.title: cctv images released after man punched in bracknell
text: police have released images of a man they would like to speak to in relation to an assault in bracknell .
the victim , a 22-year-old man , was outside the goose pub in station road , at around 12.30am on 22 october when he was punched by a man - knocking him unconscious .
the offender left the scene towards bracknell town centre .
anyone with information should call 101 .

documents.title: rolf harris sexual assault trial to begin
text: the sexual assault trial of television entertainer rolf harris , who used to live in bray , berkshire , is due to start today .
he 's accused of indecently assaulting young girls over a period of more than 30 years .
harris has already pleaded not guilty to the seven counts of indecent assault and one alternative charge of sexual assault .
jurors were told the trial is likely to conclude around mid-february .
author: Sarah Lee
BBC South

documents.title: today 's weather : dry to start but rain outbreaks later
text: good morning , we 've got some dry and occasionally bright weather to start with but we will have some patchy outbreaks of rain later .
there will be highs of 9c .

documents.title: good morning !
text: good morning from all of us here at bbc berkshire .
the weather today ?
well , there will be variable cloud and a few showers this morning , but otherwise it will mainly be dry with bright spells .
saddle up for all the latest news , travel an weather on this tremendous tuesday .
